root_cause: Memory leak in Node.js microservice, improper event listener cleanup
resolution: Deployed hotfix with proper cleanup, added memory monitoring
lessons: Memory profiling should be part of CI/CD
Canary deployments would have caught this
Need better resource limit testing in staging

impact: Complete platform outage, all services affected
root_cause: Master-replica lag triggered simultaneous failover, split brain scenario
resolution: Manual intervention, promoted specific replica, restored consistency
lessons: Redis Sentinel configuration needs tuning (quorum size)
Network partition testing critical
Need automated runbooks for common scenarios

impact: User uploads not immediately visible, support tickets increased
root_cause: Assumed strong consistency, but used non-versioned bucket
resolution: Migrated to S3 versioning, strong read-after-write consistency
lessons: S3 consistency model matters - versioning = strong consistency
Document architectural assumptions
User expectation management critical

impact: Event processing delayed 6+ hours, SLA breach
root_cause: Reserved concurrency too low, spike in events caused throttling
resolution: Increased reserved concurrency, added SQS buffer, implemented backpressure
lessons: Provisioned concurrency != reserved concurrency (different use cases)
SQS FIFO can be bottleneck with high throughput
Cost vs reliability trade-off must be explicit

impact: New pods pending, cannot deploy updates
root_cause: AWS service quota limit (EC2 instance limit) reached
resolution: Requested quota increase, implemented quota monitoring
lessons: AWS quotas are real - monitor them proactively
Multi-AZ doesn't help if quota is account-wide
Karpenter handles this better than Cluster Autoscaler

impact: Read replicas serving stale data, analytics broken
root_cause: Large table schema migration blocked replication
resolution: Paused migration, used pt-online-schema-change for zero-downtime
lessons: Schema changes on large tables need special tools
Monitor replication lag metrics continuously
Blue-green deployment strategy for database changes

impact: Users seeing wrong content, potential data leak
root_cause: Cache key configuration included sensitive headers
resolution: Purged cache, fixed cache key policy, added validation
lessons: Cache key design critical for security
Origin response headers matter
CDN misconfigurations can be security vulnerabilities

root_cause: Concurrent Terraform runs without state locking
resolution: Restored from backup, implemented DynamoDB locking, added CI/CD safeguards
lessons: State locking is not optional
Backup strategy for state files critical
Terraform Cloud or Atlantis worth the investment

impact: Security audit failure, potential compliance issue
root_cause: Used wildcard in IAM policy during testing, forgot to restrict
resolution: Audited all policies, implemented least privilege, added policy validation in CI
lessons: Never use wildcards in production IAM policies
IaC policy validation (OPA, Checkov) is mandatory
Regular IAM audits prevent drift
